free_txt: SD: Major corrections in all Subents.

bib_record.title: Stellar (n,gamma) cross sections of Hf-174 and radioactive Hf-182

free_txt: Corrections were made for extended sample geometry,
for neutron self-absorption. The correction for the
surviving fraction of the preceding activation was
made only for the calculation of the Hf-181 activity.
*By authors* The samples were activated in a series of
A single HPGe-detector with a fixed measuring
position 76-mm in front of the detector was used for
counting the activity of the gold foils. The detector
was shielded by 10-cm of lead and 5-mm of copper.
The lower activities of the hafnium
samples were measured with a gamma-detection system
consisting of two HPGE Clover detector, each Clover
detector consists of four independent HPGE N-type
crystal in a common cryostat. The total crystal
volume of the detector system is about 1000 cm-cube.
The two Clover  detectors are placed face to face
in a close geometry and from nearly a 4-pi array
by touching the 5.2 mm thick sample holder.
The error in integrated neutron flux
30 mum thick layers of metallic Li or

For the Hf-174 activations, thin samples Hf-3 to Hf-5
of natural isotopic abundance (see table below) were
cut from metal foils of whereas the Hf-182 activations
were carried out with samples Hf-1 and Hf-2, which
were prepared from the original Helmer-2 sample
